summary: This document is a collection of forwarded email correspondence from October 10, 2018, containing numerous travel notifications sent by attorney Darren Indyke on behalf of his client Jeffrey Epstein to the Virgin Islands Sex Offender Registry. The emails detail Epstein's frequent international and domestic travel plans between his residences in the U.S. Virgin Islands, New York, Palm Beach, Paris, and other locations from January to October 2018, using private aircraft with tail numbers N212JE and N120JE.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of all travel notifications; a registered sex offender required to report travel plans to the Virgin Islands authorities. He is described as traveling frequently between multiple residences.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: The sender of the vast majority of the travel notification emails on behalf of Jeffrey Epstein. He provides detailed itineraries and contact information, acting as Epstein's legal representative in communications with the registry.

persons.name: Brad
persons.context: Addressed in a forwarding note, indicating the compiled travel notifications were being sent to him, likely a U.S. Marshal involved in monitoring Epstein.

connections.description: Indyke acts as Epstein's attorney, formally notifying the sex offender registry of his client's travel plans and modifications on his behalf.
Brad (from USMS) is a recipient of Epstein's travel notifications, indicating a law enforcement monitoring relationship due to Epstein's sex offender status.

events.title: Epstein's Frequent Travel Period
events.description: A continuous series of domestic and international trips taken by Jeffrey Epstein between his residences in the U.S. Virgin Islands, New York City, Palm Beach (FL), Paris (France), Stanley (NM), and other locations like Cambridge (MA) and Tucson (AZ).

events.title: Epstein's Illness Delay
events.description: Darren Indyke notifies the registry that Epstein has become ill, forcing a delay in his travel from Palm Beach to New York until March 1, 2018.

events.title: Cancellation of Paris Trip
events.description: A planned trip from New York to Paris is canceled. Epstein instead travels from New York to Palm Beach, Florida.

locations: 34-38 Kronprindsens Gade, GERS Building, 2nd Floor, St. Thomas, Virgin Islands 00802 (Virgin Islands DOJ Registry Office)
Long Island MacArthur Airport, Ronkonkoma, New York
Cyril E. King Airport, St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
Nice Cote d'Azur Airport, Nice, France
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was a registered sex offender in the U.S. Virgin Islands and was required to report all travel plans to the Territorial Sex Offender Registry.

Epstein maintained and frequently traveled between multiple "vacation homes" in New York City, Palm Beach (FL), Paris (France), and Stanley (NM), with a "permanent residence" in the U.S. Virgin Islands.
Epstein's travel was conducted via private aircraft, primarily using tail numbers N212JE and N120JE.
His attorney, Darren K. Indyke, was the primary point of contact for all travel notifications, sending frequent emails with detailed itineraries and last-minute modifications.
The compiled emails were forwarded to a U.S. Marshal (Brad) on October 10, 2018, indicating law enforcement monitoring of Epstein's movements.
